item.title: 'Policy reforms, ethical business key to competitiveness after LDC graduation'
item.description: Analysts and business leaders on Thursday said comprehensive policy reforms, stronger institutional efficiency and an uncompromising commitment to ethical business practices are crucial for Bangladesh to sustain its competitiveness in the post-LDC graduation era. The observations came at a high-le

item.title: Irish attorney general raises concerns on sanctioning services in Israeli settlements
item.description: Ireland's top government lawyer has raised several "significant" legal and practical issues in long-awaited advice on whether planned curbs on trade with Israeli settlements should be extended to services, a junior minister said on Thursday. Ireland has been preparing a law to curb trade with sett

item.title: Bangladesh Bank reconstitutes UFIL board amid financial turmoil
item.description: Bangladesh Bank (BB) has dissolved the existing board of directors of Uttara Finance and Investments Limited and formed a new board to rescue the struggling non-bank financial institution (NBFI) from deep-rooted loan irregularities. The listed company shared this information through the Dhaka Stoc

item.title: Army flags misinformation as ‘key threat’ before polls
item.description: The Bangladesh Army considers the spread of false and misleading information on social media the “biggest threat” to the national election, a senior officer has said. On Thursday, he called for cooperation from all quarters, warning against the misuse of artificial intelligence (AI).

item.title: Grand finale of Marks Active School Genius competition held
item.description: The grand finale of the “Marks Active School Genius” competition, organised by Marks Active School, an initiative of leading industrial conglomerate Abul Khair Group, in collaboration with 10 Minute School, has been successfully held. Champions from each category received the Champions

item.title: BNP set to announce election manifesto on Friday
item.description: BNP Chairman Tarique Rahman is set to announce the party’s election manifesto for the 13th parliamentary election on Friday. BNP media cell member Sayrul Kabir Khan said the manifesto will be unveiled at 3:30pm at Sonargaon Hotel in the capital. He said party Secretary General Mirza Fakhrul

item.title: New PM likely to take oath Feb 15 or 16: Press Secy
item.description: The interim government will relinquish its responsibilities “quickly” following the parliamentary elections, Chief Advisor’s Press Secretary Shafiqul Alam has said. On Thursday, he indicated that the new prime minister could take the oath three days after polling. Speaking at a

item.title: VAT, tax relief approved for local LPG supply
item.description: In a bid to maintain a steady supply of liquefied petroleum gas (LPG), the Advisory Council has approved VAT and tax exemptions at the local production and trader level. The decisions came at a meeting of the Advisory Council at the Chief Advisor’s Office (CAO) in Dhaka’s Tejgaon on Th

item.title: Epstein helps DP World in London port project, reports Telegraph
item.description: The sex offender Jeffrey Epstein aided Sultan Ahmed bin Sulayem, chairman of UAE port operator DP World, as he sought to extract government loan guarantees and investment for the £1.8bn London Port project, reveals the Telegraph, an influential London based daily. According to the Daily, in

item.title: All 166 kidnapped churchgoers now rescued in northern Nigeria, Christian group says
item.description: Security services have now rescued all 166 worshippers who were kidnapped by gunmen during attacks on two churches in northern Nigeria last month, a Christian group said on Thursday. The Christian Association of Nigeria credited the power of prayer and the military for the success of the operation

item.title: Inqilab Moncho stages sit-in outside Jamuna, demands UN-led probe into Hadi killing
item.description: Inqilab Moncho on Thursday staged a sit-in outside the Chief Adviser’s official residence, Jamuna, demanding an impartial investigation under United Nations supervision into the killing of its spokesperson Sharif Osman Hadi. The protest began around 5pm with Inqilab Mancha Member Secretary A

item.title: Morocco evacuates 143,000 people in northwest as flood precaution, interior ministry says
item.description: Moroccan authorities have evacuated more than 143,000 people in the flood-prone northwestern plains, the interior ministry said on Thursday, amid rising threats of inundation from heavy rain, swollen rivers and the release of more water from full dams.
